verses.verse: Hear<WH8085> ye the word<WH1697> which the LORD<WH3068> speaketh<WH1696> unto you, O house<WH1004> of Israel<WH3478>:

Thus saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068>, Learn<WH3925> not the way<WH1870> of the heathen<WH1471>, and be not dismayed<WH2865> at the signs<WH226> of heaven<WH8064>; for the heathen<WH1471> are dismayed<WH2865> at them<WH1992>.

For the customs<WH2708> of the people<WH5971> are vain<WH1892>: for one cutteth<WH3772> a tree<WH6086> out of the forest<WH3293>, the work<WH4639> of the hands<WH3027> of the workman<WH2796>, with the axe<WH4621>.
They deck<WH3302> it with silver<WH3701> and with gold<WH2091>; they fasten<WH2388> it with nails<WH4548> and with hammers<WH4717>, that it move<WH6328> not.

They are upright<WH4749> as the palm tree<WH8560>, but speak<WH1696> not: they must needs<WH5375> be borne<WH5375>, because they cannot go<WH6805>. Be not afraid<WH3372> of them; for they cannot do evil<WH7489>, neither also is it in them to do good<WH3190>.
Forasmuch as there is none like unto thee, O LORD<WH3068>; thou art great<WH1419>, and thy name<WH8034> is great<WH1419> in might<WH1369>.

Who would not fear<WH3372> thee, O King<WH4428> of nations<WH1471>? for to thee doth it appertain<WH2969>: forasmuch as among all the wise<WH2450> men of the nations<WH1471>, and in all their kingdoms<WH4438>, there is none like unto thee.
But they are altogether<WH259> brutish<WH1197> and foolish<WH3688>: the stock<WH6086> is a doctrine<WH4148> of vanities<WH1892>.

Silver<WH3701> spread into plates<WH7554> is brought<WH935> from Tarshish<WH8659>, and gold<WH2091> from Uphaz<WH210>, the work<WH4639> of the workman<WH2796>, and of the hands<WH3027> of the founder<WH6884>: blue<WH8504> and purple<WH713> is their clothing<WH3830>: they are all the work<WH4639> of cunning<WH2450> men.

But the LORD<WH3068> is the true<WH571> God<WH430>, he is the living<WH2416> God<WH430>, and an everlasting<WH5769> king<WH4428>: at his wrath<WH7110> the earth<WH776> shall tremble<WH7493>, and the nations<WH1471> shall not be able to abide<WH3557> his indignation<WH2195>.

Thus<WH1836> shall ye say<WH560> unto them, The gods<WH426> that have not<WH3809> made<WH5648> the heavens<WH8065> and the earth<WH778>, even they shall perish<WH7> from the earth<WH772>, and from under<WH8460> these<WH429> heavens<WH8065>.

He hath made<WH6213> the earth<WH776> by his power<WH3581>, he hath established<WH3559> the world<WH8398> by his wisdom<WH2451>, and hath stretched out<WH5186> the heavens<WH8064> by his discretion<WH8394>.

When he uttereth<WH5414> his voice<WH6963>, there is a multitude<WH1995> of waters<WH4325> in the heavens<WH8064>, and he causeth the vapours<WH5387> to ascend<WH5927> from the ends<WH7097> of the earth<WH776>; he maketh<WH6213> lightnings<WH1300> with rain<WH4306>, and bringeth forth<WH3318> the wind<WH7307> out of his treasures<WH214>.

Every man<WH120> is brutish<WH1197> in his knowledge<WH1847>: every founder<WH6884> is confounded<WH3001> by the graven image<WH6459>: for his molten image<WH5262> is falsehood<WH8267>, and there is no breath<WH7307> in them.
They are vanity<WH1892>, and the work<WH4639> of errors<WH8595>: in the time<WH6256> of their visitation<WH6486> they shall perish<WH6>.

The portion<WH2506> of Jacob<WH3290> is not like them: for he is the former<WH3335> of all things; and Israel<WH3478> is the rod<WH7626> of his inheritance<WH5159>: The LORD<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> is his name<WH8034>.
¶ Gather up<WH622> thy wares<WH3666> out of the land<WH776>, O inhabitant<WH3427> of the fortress<WH4692>.

For thus saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068>, Behold, I will sling<WH7049> out the inhabitants<WH3427> of the land<WH776> at this once<WH6471>, and will distress<WH6887> them, that they may find<WH4672> it so.
¶ Woe<WH188> is me for my hurt<WH7667>! my wound<WH4347> is grievous<WH2470>: but I said<WH559>, Truly<WH389> this is a grief<WH2483>, and I must bear<WH5375> it.

My tabernacle<WH168> is spoiled<WH7703>, and all my cords<WH4340> are broken<WH5423>: my children<WH1121> are gone forth<WH3318> of me, and they are not: there is none to stretch forth<WH5186> my tent<WH168> any more, and to set up<WH6965> my curtains<WH3407>.
For the pastors<WH7462> are become brutish<WH1197>, and have not sought<WH1875> the LORD<WH3068>: therefore they shall not prosper<WH7919>, and all their flocks<WH4830> shall be scattered<WH6327>.

Behold, the noise<WH6963> of the bruit<WH8052> is come<WH935>, and a great<WH1419> commotion<WH7494> out of the north<WH6828> country<WH776>, to make<WH7760> the cities<WH5892> of Judah<WH3063> desolate<WH8077>, and a den<WH4583> of dragons<WH8577>.
¶ O LORD<WH3068>, I know<WH3045> that the way<WH1870> of man<WH120> is not in himself: it is not in man<WH376> that walketh<WH1980> to direct<WH3559> his steps<WH6806>.
O LORD<WH3068>, correct<WH3256> me, but with judgment<WH4941>; not in thine anger<WH639>, lest thou bring me to nothing<WH4591>.

Pour out<WH8210> thy fury<WH2534> upon the heathen<WH1471> that know<WH3045> thee not, and upon the families<WH4940> that call<WH7121> not on thy name<WH8034>: for they have eaten up<WH398> Jacob<WH3290>, and devoured<WH398> him, and consumed<WH3615> him, and have made his habitation<WH5116> desolate<WH8074>.
